pullrequest.title: Plugin to control the Cessna model

pull_request.title: Plugin to control the Cessna model

update.description:
* CessnaPlugin: Allow control of the thrust (0-100%) and control surfaces from -30deg to 30deg. The propeller has a velocity PID to maintain RPMs, while the control surfaces have position PIDs.

* CessnaGUIPlugin: Cessna control using the keyboard:
  
    * 'a': Increase thrust.
    * 'z': Decrease thrust.
    * 's': Increase flaps.
    * 'x': Decrease flaps.
    * 'd': Increase elevators.
    * 'c': Decrease elevators.
    * 'f': Increase rudder.
    * 'v': Decrease rudder.

For the shake of simplicity, left and wing flaps and ailerons are coupled when we press 's' or 'x'. The plugin allows independent control if needed.

There's a sample world file available named `cessna_demo.world`. 
   
Note for pilots: the plane is not going to fly yet. We'll add the `liftDragPlugin` in the next pull request.
update.title: Plugin to control the Cessna model

pullrequest.title: Plugin to control the Cessna model

content.raw:
Just one detail, `S` is used to enter the scaling mode. I realize that changing this would mess up your layout though, so I think it's not confusing enough that it needs to be changed.

For reference, I think these are the only letter keys which have functionality by themselves:

* `R`: rotate

* `T`: translate

* `S`: scale

* `N`: snap
content.html:
Just one detail, S is used to enter the scaling mode. I realize that changing this would mess up your layout though, so I think it's not confusing enough that it needs to be changed.

For reference, I think these are the only letter keys which have functionality by themselves:

  • R: rotate

  • T: translate

  • S: scale

  • N: snap

content.raw:
Man, in our road to make something like the good old  "Microsoft flight simulator", awesome.

All the keyboard controls work for me but I'm getting a black square in the GUI. It should be something there?

![plane.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1688187535-plane.png)
content.html:
Man, in our road to make something like the good old "Microsoft flight simulator", awesome.
